results.title: Microsurgical replantation
results.brief_description: Focuses on microsurgery and the successful “replantation” of fingers and toes with full use and feelings. This program also explains the problems associated with finding the necessary parts (including veins) that are needed for a successful operation. Finally emphasis is made on the need for continued research in the area of microsurgery. Contains some graphic images.

results.title: Microsurgery workshop
results.brief_description: Every year Dr Earl Owen at Sydney’s Prince of Wales Hospital conducts a two day work shop in microsurgery for other interested doctors. The film shows doctors working on models and live patients while Dr Owen explains some operating techniques which he uses particularly in cases of severed fingers.

results.title: Mick Doohan
results.creator_credit: Sergi Sendra, Paco Latorre and Dorna
results.brief_description: This extensive profile of motorcycle racing world champion Mick Doohan charts the major milestones of his remarkable career from 1992-1996. Footage of his most memorable races is backgrounded by an extensive personal interview. His family, mechanics, friends and race rivals also give insights into his personal life and career.

results.title: Michigan, USA
results.brief_description: Michigan in the heart of America surrounded by the Great Lakes offers entertainment, relaxation, scenic beauty and history to the visitor. Detroit city, the ultimate in modern civilization and industrialisation; nostalgic Mackinac Island where motor vehicles are prohibited; historic Greenfield Village with its blacksmith; water sports on the numerous lakes, and exciting winter sports are but a few of the attractions.

results.title: Michelangelo (Caprese 1475 - Rome 1564)
results.creator_credit: Ugo De Lucia, Giovanni Gronchi and Romor Film
results.brief_description: Shows the course of development of Michelangelo both as an artist and as a man. Beginning with the Madonna della Scala, done when the artist was fifteen years old, and ending with the Pieta Rondanini, we are visually led by commentator Carlo Ragghianti showing the course of development of Michelangelo Buonarotti both as an artist and as a man.

results.title: Michael Faraday, 1791-1867
results.brief_description: This appreciation by Sir William Bragg to mark the Centenary of Faraday’s discovery of electro-magnetic induction was re-issued in 1962. Traces Faraday’s early life, and his interest in the connections between electricity and magnetism. Shows a reconstruction of theatre in which he gave his lectures and illustrates his experiment on the influence that a magnet can exert on a coil.

results.title: Michael Casson, studio potter
results.brief_description: The stoneware of Michael Casson has won international acclaim. The stages in making one pot are described, and many fine examples of the potter’s completed work are shown in his Buckinghamshire workshop. Casson provides his own commentary: “Pottery is really my whole life”.

results.title: Mice but no men
results.brief_description: The autobiography of a mouse. We follow his adventures from the first timid adventures beyond his nest; the first “apartment” in a shoe; his contact with the outside world and the farm yard animals, including a large tabby cat.

results.title: Mexico: four views
results.brief_description: Takes a look at Mexico through the eyes of four people: a farmer, a truck driver, a teacher and a housing contractor. They talk of daily life and the history of the nation.

results.title: Metamorphosis of the cello
results.brief_description: When a sensitive and accomplished musician plays on such a beautiful instrument as this cello, there comes into being a creation of beauty - music whose power stirs our emotions. what causes this effect - the composer, performer or craftsman who made the instrument? This portrait if the cellist and the history of the cello itself corresponds with the different movements of the music played.
